In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
s = "This is a test string to demonstrate the wrapping function. It should wrap after every 10 characters."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

Output:

```
This is a test
string to
demonstrate the
wrapping function.
It should wrap
after every 10
characters.
```
